springroll.easeljs.BitmapMovieClip.name: springroll.easeljs.BitmapMovieClip
springroll.easeljs.BitmapMovieClip.description:
A class similar to createjs.MovieClip, but made to play animations from a
springroll.easeljs.TextureAtlas. The EaselJS Sprite class requires a spritesheet with equal
sized and spaced frames. By using TextureAtlas, you can use a much smaller spritesheet,
sprites on screen with fewer extra transparent pixels, and use the same API as MovieClip.

Format for BitmapMovieClip data:

	{
		fps:30,
		labels:
		{
			animStart:0,
			animStart_loop:15
		},
		origin:{ x: 20, y:30 },
		frames:
		[
			{
				name:"myAnim#",
				min:1,
				max:20,
				digits:4
			}
		],
		scale:1
	}

The example object describes a 30 fps animation that is 20 frames long, and was originally
myAnim0001.png->myAnim0020.png, with frame labels on the first and 16th frames. 'digits' is
optional, and defaults to 4.

params.name: atlas
params.description: The texture atlas to pull frames from.

params.name: data
params.description: Initialization data

props.name: fps
props.description:
Framerate to play the movieclip at. Omitting this will use the
                        current framerate.

props.name: labels
props.description:
A dictionary of the labels in the movieclip to assist in
                              playing animations.

props.name: origin
props.description: The origin of the movieclip.

props.name: frames
props.description: An array of frame sequences to pull from the texture atlas.

props.name: name
props.description:
The name to use for the frame sequence. This should
                                   include a "#" to be replaced with the image number.

props.name: min
props.description: The first frame number in the frame sequence.

props.name: max
props.description: The last frame number in the frame sequence.

props.name: digits
props.description:
The maximum number of digits in the names of the frames,
                                    e.g. myAnim0001 has 4 digits.

props.name: scale
props.description:
The scale at which the art was exported, e.g. a scale of 1.4
                               means the art was increased in size to 140% before exporting
                               and should be scaled back down before drawing to the screen.

springroll.easeljs.ReversePlayback.name: springroll.easeljs.ReversePlayback
springroll.easeljs.ReversePlayback.description:
Create an update listener that checks plays the animation
in reverse. Requires the animation to have the same labeling
system as the springroll.Animator system.
	i.e. each animation must have a corresponding ending frame
	marked with	a '_stop' and '_loop' suffixes,
	for instance: "walk" requires "walk_loop"

params.name: clip
params.description: The MovieClip containing the timeline and animation

springroll.easeljs.TextureAtlas.name: springroll.easeljs.TextureAtlas
springroll.easeljs.TextureAtlas.description:
Handles a spritesheet. File extensions and folder paths are dropped from frame names upon
loading.

params.name: image
params.description:
The image that all textures pull from. This can
                                             also be an array of images, if the TextureAtlas
                                             should be built from several spritesheets.

params.name: spritesheetData
params.description:
The JSON object describing the frames in the atlas. This
                                      is expected to fit the JSON Hash format as exported from
                                      TexturePacker. This can also be an array of data
                                      objects, if the TextureAtlas should be built from
                                      several spritesheets.

springroll.easeljs.Texture.name: springroll.easeljs.Texture
springroll.easeljs.Texture.description:
A Texture - a specific portion of an image that can then be drawn by a Bitmap.
This class is hidden within TextureAtlas, and can't be manually created.

Cutscene is a class for playing a single EaselJS animation synced to a

props.name: display

props.name: configUrl

props.name: loadCallback

props.name: pathReplaceTarg
props.description:
A string found in the paths of images that should
                                          be replaced with another value.

props.name: pathReplaceVal
props.description:
The string to use when replacing
                                         options.pathReplaceTarg.

props.name: imageScale
props.description:
Scaling to apply to all images loaded for the
                                       cutscene.

props.name: captions
props.description: A Captions instance to display captions text on.

springroll.easeljs.Button.name: springroll.easeljs.Button
springroll.easeljs.Button.description:
A Multipurpose button class. It is designed to have one image, and an optional text label.
The button can be a normal button or a selectable button.
The button functions similarly with both EaselJS and PIXI, but slightly differently in
initialization and callbacks. Add event listeners for click and mouseover to know about
button clicks and mouse overs, respectively.

params.name: imageSettings
params.description:
Information about the art to be used for button states, as well as if the button is selectable or not.
       If this is an Image or Canvas element, then the button assumes that the image is full width and 3 images
       tall, in the order (top to bottom) up, over, down. If so, then the properties of imageSettings are ignored.

props.name: image
props.description: The image to use for all of the button states.

props.name: up
props.description: The visual information about the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were
       trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: over
props.description: The visual information about the over state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were
       trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: down
props.description: The visual information about the down state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were
       trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: disabled
props.description: The visual information about the disabled state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were
       trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override
       data in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: <yourCustomState>
props.description:
The visual information about a custom state found in imageSettings.priority.
       Any state added this way has a property of the same name added to the button. Examples of previous states that have been
       moved to this system are "selected" and "highlighted".

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels
       were trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter
       override data in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be
       overridden.

props.name: origin
props.description:
An optional offset for all button graphics, in case you want button
       positioning to not include a highlight glow, or any other reason you would want to offset the button art and label.

params.name:
[imageSettings.priority=null] The state priority order. If omitted, defaults to ["disabled", "down", "over", "up"].
       Previous versions of Button used a hard coded order: ["highlighted", "disabled", "down", "over", "selected", "up"]
label
params.description: Information about the text label on the button. Omitting this makes the button not use a label.

props.name: text
props.description: The text to display on the label.

props.name: font
props.description: The font name and size to use on the label, as createjs.Text expects.

props.name: color
props.description: The color of the text to use on the label, as createjs.Text expects.

props.name: textBaseline
props.description: The baseline for the label text, as createjs.Text expects.

props.name: stroke
props.description: The stroke to use for the label text, if desired, as createjs.Text (springroll fork only) expects.

props.name: shadow
props.description: A shadow object to apply to the label text.

props.name: x
props.description:
An x position to place the label text at relative to the button. If omitted,
       "center" is used, which attempts to horizontally center the label on the button.

props.name: y
props.description:
A y position to place the label text at relative to the button. If omitted,
       "center" is used, which attempts to vertically center the label on the button. This may be unreliable -
       see documentation for createjs.Text.getMeasuredLineHeight().

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not the button is initially enabled.

animation.

                                    interrupted.

springroll.pixi.ParallelSpineData.description:
Class for assisting in creating an array of Spine animations to play at the same time
on one skeleton through Animator. Concurrent animations will play until one non-looping
animation ends.

params.name: anim
params.description: The name of the animation on the skeleton.

params.name: loop
params.description: If this animation should loop.

params.name: speed
params.description: The speed at which this animation should be played.

springroll.pixi.AssetManager.name: springroll.pixi.AssetManager
springroll.pixi.AssetManager.description:
AssetManager is responsible for managing different resolutions of assets and spritesheets
based on the resolution of the stage. This is a helpful optimization for PIXI because some
low-hardware devices have a problem keeping up with larger images, or just refuse large
images entirely. The AssetManager does not load assets itself, or keep track of what is
loaded. It merely assists in loading the appropriate assets, as well as easily unloading
assets when you are done using them.

springroll.pixi.Button.name: springroll.pixi.Button
springroll.pixi.Button.description:
A Multipurpose button class. It is designed to have one image, and an optional text label.
The button can be a normal button or a selectable button.
The button functions similarly with both EaselJS and PIXI, but slightly differently in
initialization and callbacks.
Use releaseCallback and overCallback to know about button clicks and mouse overs, respectively.

params.name: imageSettings
params.description: Information about the art to be used for button states, as well as if the button is selectable or not.

props.name: up
props.description:
The texture for the up state of the button. This can be either the texture itself,
       or an object with 'tex' and 'label' properties.

props.name: tex
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data 
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" and "type" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: over
props.description: The texture for the over state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: tex
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data 
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" and "type" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: down
props.description: The texture for the down state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: tex
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data 
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" and "type" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: disabled
props.description: The texture for the disabled state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: tex
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter override data 
       in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" and "type" from the label parameter may be overridden.

props.name: <yourCustomState>
props.description:
The visual information about a custom state found in imageSettings.priority.
       Any state added this way has a property of the same name added to the button. Examples of previous states that have been
       moved to this system are "selected" and "highlighted".

props.name: tex
props.description: The texture for the custom state.

props.name: label
props.description:
Label information specific to this state. Properties on this parameter 
       override data in the label parameter for this button state only. All values except "text" from the label parameter may be
       overridden.

props.name: origin
props.description:
An optional offset for all button graphics, in case you want button 
       positioning to not include a highlight glow, or any other reason you would want to offset the button art and label.

props.name: scale
props.description: The scale to use for the textures. This allows smaller art assets than the designed size to be used.

params.name:
[imageSettings.priority=null] The state priority order. If omitted, defaults to ["disabled", "down", "over", "up"].
       Previous versions of Button used a hard coded order: ["highlighted", "disabled", "down", "over", "selected", "up"]
label
params.description: Information about the text label on the button. Omitting this makes the button not use a label.

props.name: type
props.description: If label.type is "bitmap", then a PIXI.BitmapText text is created, otherwise a PIXI.Text is created for the label.

props.name: text
props.description: The text to display on the label.

props.name: style
props.description: The style of the text field, in the format that PIXI.BitmapText and PIXI.Text expect.

props.name: x
props.description: An x position to place the label text at relative to the button.

props.name: y
props.description:
A y position to place the label text at relative to the button. If omitted,
       "center" is used, which attempts to vertically center the label on the button.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not the button is initially enabled.

springroll.Enum.name: springroll.Enum
springroll.Enum.description:
An enumeration, similar to Enums in C#. Each value is created as an EnumValue on the Enum,
referenced as a property with the same name as the EnumValue. Examples:

		var myEnum = new springroll.Enum(
			"valueOf0",
			"valueOf1",
			"valueOf2");
		var myOtherEnum = new springroll.Enum(
			{name: "one", value:"1", toString:"I am the One!"},
			"two",
			{name:"screwSequentialNumbers", value:42});
			
		myEnum.valueOf0 != 0;//enum values are not integers
		myEnum.valueOf1 != myOtherEnum.one;//enum values are not the same as other enums
		myEnum.valueOf2.asInt == 2;//enum values can be explicitly compared to integers
		myOtherEnum.screwSequentialNumbers == myOtherEnum.valueFromInt(42);//can use ints to get values
		console.log(myOtherEnum.one.toString());//outputs "I am the One!"

		for (var i in myEnum) console.log(i); //outputs "valueOf0","valueOf1","valueOf2"

params.name: arguments
params.description:
The list of enumeration values. You can pass either an
 array or a list of parameters. Each string will be
 the previous value plus one, while objects with
 'name' and 'value' properties will have the specified
 numeric value.

classitems.description: Play an animation for a frame label event
classitems.name: play

params.name: instance
params.description:
The MovieClip or display object with the same API
                                        to animate.

params.name: eventList
params.description:
One of or an array of the following
* objects in the format:

       {
           anim:"myAnim",
           start:0,
           speed:1,
           audio:{alias:"MyAlias", start:300}
       }

   * anim is the frame label of the animation to play, e.g. "onClose" to "onClose_stop".
   * start is milliseconds into the animation to start (0 if omitted). A value of -1
       starts from a random time in the animation.
   * speed is a multiplier for the animation speed (1 if omitted).
   * audio is audio to sync the animation to using springroll.Sound. audio can be a String
       if you want the audio to start 0 milliseconds into the animation.
* strings - frame labels, e.g. "onClose" to "onClose_stop".
* numbers - milliseconds to wait.
* functions - called upon reaching, followed immediately by the next item.

params.description:
A callback function for when an animation is
                                        stopped with Animator.stop() or to play another
                                        animation. A value of 'true' uses onComplete for
                                        onCancelled.

classitems.description:
By default BitmapMovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for
the BitmapMovieClip will cause it to advance based on elapsed time between ticks as
appropriate to maintain the target framerate.

For example, if a BitmapMovieClip with a framerate of 10 is placed on a Stage being updated
at 40fps, then the BitmapMovieClip will advance roughly one frame every 4 ticks. This will
not be exact, because the time between each tick will vary slightly between frames.

This feature is dependent on the tick event object (or an object with an appropriate "delta"
property) being passed into {{#crossLink "Stage/update"}}{{/crossLink}}.

seconds.

classitems.description:
Loads a list of assets. All javascript files will be parsed so that they can be unloaded
later. Additionally, AssetManager will handle spritesheets automatically. AssetManager looks
for special manifest items that would otherwise be invalid to handle spritesheets or images
that have been split into alpha and color images.
A manifest item for a TextureAtlas - this will create a TextureAtlas instance, accessible via
AssetManager.getAtlas("myAssetId"):

    {
        "id":"myAssetId",
        "atlasData":"path/asset.json",
        "atlasImage":"path/asset.png"
    }

A manifest item for a spritesheet that should be run through BitmapUtils.loadSpriteSheet()
so that the individual sprites can be accessed via the global 'lib' dictionary:

    {
        "id":"myAssetId",
        "atlasData":"path/asset.json",
        "atlasImage":"path/asset.png",
        "splitForEaselJS":true
    }

A manifest item for a single image that has been split into color and alpha images that
should be recombined upon loading:

    {
        "id":"myAssetId",
        "color":"path/asset-color.jpg",
        "alpha":"path/asset-alpha.png"
    }

A manifest item for a TextureAtlas or spritesheet that has been split into color and
alpha images:

    {
        "id":"myAssetId",
        "atlasData":"path/asset.json",
        "color":"path/asset-color.jpg",
        "alpha":"path/asset-alpha.png"
    }

A manifest item for a JSON that is configuration data for a BitmapMovieClip - it can be
retrieved via AssetManager.getBitmapMovieClipConfig("myAssetId"):

    {
        "id":"myAssetId",
        "src":"path/asset.json",
        "bmcConfig":true
    }

                                      loading. If omitted, loads immediately with an internal
                                      TaskManager.

classitems.description:
Pulled from EaselJS's SpriteSheetUtils.
Merges the rgb channels of one image with the alpha channel of another. This can be used to
combine a compressed JPEG image containing color data with a PNG32 monochromatic image
containing alpha data. With certain types of images (those with detail that lend itself to
JPEG compression) this can provide significant file size savings versus a single RGBA PNG32.
This method is very fast (generally on the order of 1-2 ms to run).
classitems.name: mergeAlpha

params.name: rbgImage
params.description: The image (or canvas) containing the RGB channels to use.

params.name: alphaImage
params.description: The image (or canvas) containing the alpha channel to use.

params.name: canvas
params.description:
If specified, this canvas will be used and returned. If not, a new
                         canvas will be created.

return.description:
A canvas with the combined image data. This can be used as a source for a
                 Texture.

classitems.description:
Replaces Bitmaps in the global lib dictionary with a faux Bitmap
that pulls the image from a spritesheet. This function should be
called after you have loaded up javascript assets exported from Flash,
but before you have instantiated those assets.
classitems.name: loadSpriteSheet

params.name: spritesheetData
params.description:
The JSON object describing the frames in the atlas. This is
                                expected to fit the JSON Hash format as exported from
                                TexturePacker.

params.name: spritesheetImage
params.description:
The spritesheet image that contains all of
                                                  the frames.

params.name: scale
params.description:
The scale to apply to all sprites from the spritesheet. For example,
                          a half sized spritesheet should have a scale of 2.

classitems.description: Play a specified animation
classitems.name: play

params.name: clip
params.description:
The clip to play. Animation options vary depending on
                                        object type.

params.name: animData
params.description:
One of or an array of the following
  * objects in the format:

      {
          anim:<string|array of strings|array of ParallelSpineData|array of Textures>,
          start:0,
          speed:1,
          loop:false,
          audio:{alias:"MyAlias", start:300}
      }

      * anim is the data about the animation to play. See below for more info
      * start is milliseconds into the animation to start (0 if omitted). A value of -1
          starts from a random time in the animation.
      * speed is a multiplier for the animation speed (1 if omitted).
      * loop is if the animation should loop (false if omitted).
      * audio is audio to sync the animation to using springroll.Sound. audio can be a String
          if you want the audio to start 0 milliseconds into the animation.
  * strings - A single animation to play on a Spine skeleton.
  * arrays of strings - An array of animations to play sequentially on a Spine skeleton.
  * arrays of ParallelSpineData - An array of animations to play at the same time on a
      Spine skeleton.
  * arrays of Textures - An array of textures to play on a MovieClip.
  * numbers - milliseconds to wait.
  * functions - called upon reaching, followed immediately by the next item.

params.name: onComplete
params.description: The function to call once the animation has finished.

params.name: onCancelled
params.description:
A callback function for when an animation is stopped with

classitems.description:
Pulled from EaselJS's SpriteSheetUtils.
Merges the rgb channels of one image with the alpha channel of another. This can be used to
combine a compressed JPEG image containing color data with a PNG32 monochromatic image
containing alpha data. With certain types of images (those with detail that lend itself to
JPEG compression) this can provide significant file size savings versus a single RGBA PNG32.
This method is very fast (generally on the order of 1-2 ms to run).
classitems.name: mergeAlpha

params.name: rbgImage
params.description: The image (or canvas) containing the RGB channels to use.

params.name: alphaImage
params.description: The image (or canvas) containing the alpha channel to use.

params.name: canvas
params.description:
If specified, this canvas will be used and returned. If not, a new
                         canvas will be created.

return.description:
A canvas with the combined image data. This can be used as a source for a
                 Texture.

props.description:
An optional function to call when the sound starts
                                  playback. If the sound is loaded, this is called
                                  immediately, if not, it calls when the sound is finished
                                  loading.

props.name: interrupt
props.description:
If the sound should interrupt previous sounds
                                           (SoundJS parameter). Default is false.

props.name: delay
props.description:
The delay to play the sound at in milliseconds (SoundJS
                                  parameter). Default is 0.

props.name: offset
props.description:
The offset into the sound to play in milliseconds
                                   (SoundJS parameter). Default is 0.

props.name: loop
props.description:
How many times the sound should loop. Use -1 (or true) for
                              infinite loops (SoundJS parameter). Default is no looping.

props.name: volume
props.description:
The volume to play the sound at (0 to 1). Omit to use the
                                 default for the sound.

props.name: pan
props.description:
The panning to start the sound at (-1 to 1). Default is
                                centered (0).

An internal SoundInstance object that can be used for fading in/out
                           as well as pausing and getting the sound's current position.
